fields.doc: System-generated sequential ID.
fields.name: id

fields.doc: De-identified Patron ID for record
fields.name: patron_id

fields.doc: Item ID for record
fields.name: item_id

fields.doc: Volume ID for record
fields.name: volume_id

fields.doc: Bib ID for record
fields.name: bib_id

fields.doc: Transaction date in UNIX format.
fields.name: transaction_gmt

fields.doc: The name of the program that generated the transaction. Valid program names are: circ (includes transactions made using PC Circ) circa (for transactions written by selfcheckwebserver and in-house use [transaction codes 'u' and 's'], which use webpac to execute transactions.) milcirc milmyselfcheck readreq selfcheck
fields.name: application_name

fields.doc: The transaction source. Possible values are: local INN-Reach ILL
fields.name: source_code

fields.doc: Type of transaction: o = checkout i = checkin n = hold nb = bib hold ni = item hold nv = volume hold h = hold with recall hb = hold recall bib hi = hold recall item hv = hold recall volume f = filled hold r = renewal b = booking u = use count
fields.name: op_code

fields.doc: The number of the terminal at which the transaction occurred or the user-specified statistics group number for PC-Circ transactions. Also stores the login's statistics group number for circulation transactions performed with the following Circa applications: checkout checkin count internal use
fields.name: stat_group_code_num

fields.doc: Due date in UNIX format. The application of this date depends on the op_code for the transaction. The due date is not included for bookings (op_code b) or filled holds (op_code f). For op_code 'i' (checkin), this is the original due date. For op_code 'r' (renewal), this is the renewal due date. For op_code 'o' (checkouts), this is the item due date. For op_codes 'n' (holds) and 'h' (holds with recall), a non-zero entry indicates that the hold is for a checked-out item that is due on the specified date.
fields.name: due_date_gmt

fields.doc: Indicates the type of use count (for op_code 'u'): Code Number Count Type 1 INTL USE (fixflds 93) 2 COPY USE (fixflds 94) 3 IUSE3 (fixflds 74) 4 PIUSE: generated by the system
fields.name: count_type_code_num

fields.doc: Item type code. (Defined by the library.)
fields.name: itype_code_num

fields.doc: Item code 1. (Defined by the library.)
fields.name: icode1

fields.doc: Item code 2. (Defined by the library.)
fields.name: icode2

fields.doc: A five-character location code, right-padded with spaces, from the associated item record.
fields.name: item_location_code

fields.doc: A one-character AGENCY code from the associated item record.
fields.name: item_agency_code_num

fields.doc: Patron type code. (Defined by the library.)
fields.name: ptype_code

fields.doc: Patron code 1. (Defined by the library.)
fields.name: pcode1

fields.doc: Patron code 2. (Defined by the library.)
fields.name: pcode2

fields.doc: Patron code 3. (Defined by the library.)
fields.name: pcode3

fields.doc: Patron code 4. (Defined by the library.)
fields.name: pcode4

fields.doc: A five-character location code, right-padded with spaces, from the associated patron record.
fields.name: patron_home_library_code

fields.doc: A one-character AGENCY code from the associated patron record.
fields.name: patron_agency_code_num
